name: Congestive Heart Failure, Rule out other causes of Dyspnea
shortname: Rule out other causes of Dyspnea
description:
Fever/ Productive cough → pneumonia
Chest pain → myocardial infarction
Dyspnea at rest + smoking hx → COPD

name: Congestive Heart Failure, Severity classification NYHA
description:
Class I - symptoms of HEART FAILURE only at activity levels that would limit normal individuals
Class II - symptoms of HEART FAILURE with ordinary exertion
Class III - symptoms of HEART FAILURE with less than ordinary exertion
Class IV - symptoms of HEART FAILURE at rest

Congestive Heart Failure, ER and likely IPD admission
description: If hypoxic, visibly distressed, or unable to care for self at home → admit to ER for IV diuresis

name: Congestive Heart Failure, Symptoms Decompensation
description:
BP less than 80 or greater than 180
Pulse less than 40 or greater than 120 adults
RR greater than 24
Low O2 sat

name: Congestive Heart Failure, Checklist
description:
EKG: q12 months if stable, SOS if change in status
 LABS: *Once- patients > age 65 thyroid test 
*q3months – electrolytes and Cr date / result
 *q6months:
 Hyperlipidemia – date / result
Diabetes – date / result
 *Once/year – CBC (anemia can exacerbate CHF) date / result

name: Congestive Heart Failure, Assessment
description:
If blood pressure and symptoms stable --> 4months
If hypertension – change medication --> 1 month
If worse dyspnea – increase furosemide --> 2 weeks
